name: view setup
Fill RTDS
Setup RTDS
info: Creates a Realtime Data Source with a dimension size of 20. This size can not be changed without destroying and re-creating the data source.

name: Create Dimensions
info: Creates two dimensions. One "Temperature" float dimension normalized between 0 and 50. The second dimension "Weekday" is a discrete dimension, which instead of holding a potential range of values holds a series of strings instead.

name: Insert Behavior
info: Sets the insert behavior to shift. For details on insert behaviors, check the node's documentation.

name: Fill RTDS
info: Use the CNRIF API to manually populate the Weekdays dimension.

name: Setup View
info: This function node constructs the message that the view builder node accepts. The points are set up to create a circle with rainbow colors.

name: Build View
info: This node creates the view GameObject in the scene. After its creation it can be retrieved with a get view node.

name: Apply Data
info: This node applies the XYZ positions and colors from the view setup function to the view.

name: Add Axes
info: This node adds axes to the view, making them addressable in all downstream nodes.

name: Set Axis Data
info: The RTDS dimensions are linked with the axes. The axis labels always correspond with the name of the RTDS dimension.

name: Get RTDS
info: This node retrieves the Realtime Data Source created above, messages are only passed on if it exists.

name: Shift Weekdays
info: This data stream retrieves the data from the Weekdays dimension, and re-inserts the first value, which due to the shift insert behavior cycles the list.

name: Insert Random Data
info: Inserts random data into the Temperature dimension.

name: Update View
info: Updates the view's YPosition with the current data from the Temperature dimension.

name: Update Axis
info: Updates the axis labels of the X axis by re-polling from the linked RTDS dimension, which in this case is Weekdays.
